title.narrative: Capacity Strengthening Post for Caritas Africa

description.narrative: This project will provide funding for a Capacity Strengthening post for Caritas Africa for one year. Caritas Africa has prioritized work on institutional development and capacity strengthening in its Strategic Framework Document: 2015 – 2019 under Strategic Orientation 2 ‘Reinforce Institutional Development and Capacity Strengthening’. The strategic orientation sets out five objectives as follows: i. Develop a regional institutional development and capacity building strategy in collaboration and with the support of Caritas Internationalis. ii. Roll out Caritas Internationalis Management Standards and ensure their compliance and monitoring. iii. Encourage peer support and peer-learning for capacity strengthening. iv. Identify the needs of Member Organizations and develop a targeted accompaniment programme. v. Develop an equitable human resource policy for Caritas/Church organizations in Africa. The expected outcomes for these objectives are detailed out in the Strategic Framework Document of Caritas Africa and would guide efforts at operationalizing the objectives as the key deliverables. Towards these end, CA has already established a Working Group whose membership is drawn from selected Member Organizations and the terms of reference of the Working Group was approved by the Regional Commission. A detailed road-map on IDCS was further developed by the Working Group as an operational framework to deliver the key outcomes. Following this, Caritas Internationalis provided further support to CA to develop this strategy that would guide partnership building and cooperation for the realization of the IDCS road-map.
